com.b2international.snowowl.datastore.session

Interface IApplicationSessionManager


  • public interface IApplicationSessionManager
    The service interface for the application-wide session manager.

      AccessToken requestToken(java.lang.String userId, java.security.PublicKey clientPublicKey)
      Asks the server for a one-time access token, which includes: an encrypted random sequence of bytes which can be decrypted with the private pair of the specified client public key; the server's public key, which can be used to encode the answer (the decrypted random sequence concatenated with the user's password).

    • Method Detail

      • requestToken

        AccessToken requestToken(java.lang.String userId,
                         java.security.PublicKey clientPublicKey)
        Asks the server for a one-time access token, which includes:
        • an encrypted random sequence of bytes which can be decrypted with the private pair of the specified client public key;
        • the server's public key, which can be used to encode the answer (the decrypted random sequence concatenated with the user's password).
        Parameters:
        userId -
        clientPublicKey -
        Returns:

      • loginWithResponse

        User loginWithResponse(byte[] response)
                throws java.lang.SecurityException
        Sends the server an encrypted response to provide identification for the user. The sequence to send contains the last random sequence received via requestToken(String, PublicKey), concatenated with the user's password characters. The resulting byte sequence is encrypted with the server's public key, also received with a previous AccessToken.

        If the server does not accept the sequence, a new access token will need to be requested and a SecurityException runtime exception will be thrown.

        Parameters:
        response -
        Returns:
        the logged in users identity
        Throws:
        java.lang.SecurityException

      • authenticate

        void authenticate(java.lang.String userId,
                  java.lang.String password)
           throws javax.security.auth.login.LoginException
        Parameters:
        userId - the user identifier (may not be null)
        password - the user's password (may not be null)
        Throws:
        javax.security.auth.login.LoginException - if the user identifier and/or the password was given incorrectly

      • getConnectedSessionInfo

        java.lang.Iterable<Pair<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> getConnectedSessionInfo()
        Returns with an iterable of user ID with session ID of all connected sessions.

      • enableLogins

        void enableLogins(boolean loginEnabled)
        Sets the non-administrator user login flag. true if the login is enabled, otherwise false.

      • isLoginEnabled

        boolean isLoginEnabled()
        Returns true if non-administrator login is currently allowed to the managed repositories, otherwise returns with false.
